channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: NPR's middle school champion: A moving podcast about Japanese incarceration
item.description: For the first time, NPR's Student Podcast Challenge has a returning champion: a California fifth grader who explored a dark chapter in U.S. history du...

item.title: New York City may move its mayoral elections to even years. It'd be part of a trend
item.description: This fall, New York City voters will weigh in on a proposal that could move future city elections to even-numbered years. It's part of a growing trend...

item.title: Love pumpkin spice lattes? Learn some of its spicy history
item.description: For NPR's Word of the Week: Things are getting spicy. We explain how a word referring to cinnamon and pepper turned less literal by the 19th century.

item.title: Typhoon Ragasa batters Hong Kong and southern China
item.description: Typhoon Ragasa whipped waves taller than lampposts onto Hong Kong promenades and turned seas rough on the southern Chinese coast after leaving deadly ...

item.title: 'We have to speak out,' Jimmy Kimmel says in his late night return
item.description: The comedian was suspended for nearly a week by ABC's parent company, Disney, before returning to airwaves on Tuesday night.

item.title: Moment sinkhole pulls down power lines in busy Bangkok street
item.description: Social media footage showed the massive crater in Thailand's capital leaving cars teetering on the edge.

item.title: Super Typhoon Ragasa pummels Hong Kong after killing 14 people in Taiwan
item.description: Densely populated Hong Kong is being slammed by its most powerful storm in years, with Super Typhoon Ragasa packing hurricane-force winds and a danger...

item.title: Howling winds and sheets of rain: In the eye of a typhoon in China
item.description: The strong winds hit in waves - and standing upright is almost impossible, our correspondent writes.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel calls out 'anti-American' threats to free speech in tearful TV return
item.description: The comedian returned from a brief suspension after comments he made about the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Trump crackdown highlights judge vacancy crisis pushing D.C. courts to brink
item.description: The D.C. courts have for years been hampered by judicial vacancies that have led to a backlog of cases and slowed the administration of justice.

item.title: Black church leaders reject Charlie Kirk martyrdom and point to his race rhetoric
item.description: A debate has been sparked among Black pastors who are trying to square a heroic view of Charlie Kirk, the 31-year-old conservative activist who was gu...

item.title: 9/23: CBS Evening News
item.description: Man convicted in Trump assassination attempt tries to stab himself with pen after verdict; Major League Baseball will use so-called robot umpires for ...

item.title: Kyiv can win all of Ukraine back from Russia, Trump says
item.description: The US president says Ukraine can win back land with support from Nato and Europe, marking a major shift in his position.

item.title: Six West Africans deported from US sent to Togo despite legal fight
item.description: They had started legal action against Ghana for agreeing to accept them from the US.

item.title: 9/23: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: President Trump addresses United Nations General Assembly; Retired General McChrystal using battlefield tactics to assist businesses

item.title: Author of bestseller on opioids in Appalachia helps women fight addiction
item.description: Barbara Kingsolver won a Pulitzer Prize for her bestselling novel about Appalachia's drug crisis. She invested some of the proceeds into a home for wo...

item.title: FACT FOCUS: A look at false and misleading claims made by Trump about autism, Tylenol and pregnancy
